page.title: 13MOTO CROSS 500cc GRAND PRIX
page.content: The {British Moto Cross Grand Prix}was staged on July 14 on a hillside in Farleigh Hungerford . The sport was once called scrambling but now has a new name. Two races took place that afternoon and each one was called a {"moto"}. 25,000 people came from all over the world for the weekend and many of them camped in the fields nearby. The World Championship has 12 legs each in a different country. This was the 9th set of races. The event is popular with spectators and racers but the bumpy hillside makes a demanding course. The track is 2 1/2 miles long and each race lasts for 40 minutes plus 2 laps. The winner gets 20 points towards the championship total. One Briton and a Frenchman came first in a race each .There is racing twice a year at Farleigh.
